yurifromtomsk wrote:

>Well if you use some range, then maybe it's possible to assign each subrange its own color. E.g. [-5, -3] blue, [-3, -1] green and so on.
>
>  
>
I think I'll try some different color schemes and see which looks best. 
Having said that the current red-blue scale I'm using highlights 
excitatory and inhibitory very well, which may be all you really want to 
see along with a variable connectin width.

>I also think that it's better to makke possible to toggle connections lines on and off for each neuron independently. Because in case of complex networks it's really challenging to understand just the way connections are oriented.
>  
>
Good idea. I'll see what I can do.

Thanks for the feedback,

Colin.
